definition: controlled (by sb)/to suffer under a yoke
to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)
to manufacture/to make
system/to control/to regulate/variant of 製|制[zhi4]

sentences.chinese: “低能力者受制于其虚幻的优越感”。

sentences.english: And also the profession is very much at the mercy of the market place
sentences.chinese: 而且这个行业在很大程度上受制于市场因素。

sentences.english: They all signed "mutual assistance" pacts making them virtual protectorates of the Soviet Union.
sentences.chinese: 他们都签署了使自己几乎受制于苏联的“互惠条约”。

sentences.english: They are all grappling with the same issue.
sentences.chinese: 他们都要受制于同样的问题。

sentences.english: They prefer to discipline themselves rather than to be disciplined by others.
sentences.chinese: 他们喜欢自律而不喜欢受制于人。

sentences.english: In other words, the total performance is tied to the performance of the slowest database partition.
sentences.chinese: 换言之，整体的性能受制于最慢的数据库分区的性能。
不要施加压力，不要受制于人。

sentences.english: They are bound by, they're subservient to, this metadivine realm.
sentences.chinese: 他们受制并服从于这个超神的领域。

sentences.english: Exposing yourself in Japan would apparently come under the ambit of a public indecency crime or a misdemeanor.
sentences.chinese: 在日本暴露自己显然受制于公开猥亵罪的范围或轻罪。

sentences.english: I am using the push-off in China, I feel a little controlled by others.
sentences.chinese: 我现在用的推客中国的，感觉有点受制于人。

sentences.english: They prefer to discipline themselves rather than be disciplined by others.
sentences.chinese: 他们宁愿自律，而不愿受制于人。

sentences.english: These snippets are not subject to any code management or life-cycle process.
sentences.chinese: 这些代码片段不受制于任何代码管理或生命周期流程。

sentences.english: Health care workers are subject to the same human foibles as the rest of the population.
sentences.chinese: 医疗工作者和其他人一样受制于人性的弱点。

sentences.english: If you don't run your own life, somebody else will.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不主动管理自己的一生，那么你将受制于人。

sentences.english: Whenever you have a hope, you're never really anybody's prisoner!
sentences.chinese: 只要你有梦想，你永远不会受制于人。

sentences.english: Ah, I'm so disorganized, so browbeaten by what I remember.
sentences.chinese: 啊，我的思绪如此杂乱无章，如此受制于回忆与往事。

definition: not good/of no use
to try to rouse oneself but lack the strength (idiom)
to be in straitened circumstances
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); at a loss/in a hopeless situation
lit. to refrain from shooting at the rat for fear of breaking the vases (idiom)/to not act against an evil so as to prevent harm to innocents
to stand still without advancing (idiom); to hesitate and hold back
It's hard to clap with only one hand./It takes two to tango/It's difficult to achieve anything without support.
to make progress only with great difficulty (idiom)
opponent/substantial adversary/worthy match/antagonist/in the enemy's hands
to clog up/silted up
to rush indiscriminately into action
to seize the opportunity/to strike while the iron is hot
to struggle to cope (with a situation)/to be at one's wits' end
sealed ribbon fastening correspondence (in former times)
dangerous situation/venerable old age
to force/to oblige
